page.title: 13SCHOOLS OF WEST HULL
page.content: The area contains 6 Senior schools, 5 Junior schools, 9 Primary Schools and 1 Nursery. The present system of education in Hull involves 3 stages of schooling: Primary from 5_9; Junior schools from 9_13; Senior Schools from 13_18. The East Riding also has 3 stages but the ages of children in each school are slightly different: Infant from 5_7; Junior from 7_11; Senior from 11_18. It is intended that the Hull system will be reorganised in 1988 to create a system similar to that of the East Riding. The ultimate aim of this is to cut down local goverment expenditure. Most children get to school by car, bike or on foot. A day starts at 9am and ends at 3:30_4pm. Lessons are throughout the day with 2 breaks and 1 long dinner break.
